concepts.concept_name: Characteristics of living organisms: growth, reproduction, metabolism, cellular organisation, consciousness
Biodiversity and the need for classification; taxonomic hierarchy and categories
Taxonomical aids: herbaria, botanical gardens, museums, zoological parks, keys

in_scope: Defining characteristics that distinguish living from non-living
Taxonomic hierarchy: species, genus, family, order, class, phylum, kingdom
Binomial nomenclature and rules of nomenclature
Taxonomical aids and their purposes
out_of_scope: Detailed history of taxonomy beyond Linnaeus
Numerical taxonomy and cytotaxonomy in depth

concepts.concept_name: Five-kingdom classification system by Whittaker: criteria and kingdoms
Kingdom Monera: Archaebacteria, Eubacteria, their structure and reproduction
Kingdom Protista, Fungi, and viruses/viroids/lichens

in_scope: Whittaker's five-kingdom classification and its basis
Salient features of Monera, Protista, and Fungi
Structure and reproduction of viruses, viroids, prions, and lichens
Differences between prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms
out_of_scope: Three-domain classification by Carl Woese in detail

concepts.concept_name: Classification of plants: algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, gymnosperms, angiosperms
Alternation of generations and life cycles in plants
Salient features and examples of each plant division

in_scope: General characters and classification of algae (Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae, Rhodophyceae)
Bryophytes: liverworts and mosses
Pteridophytes: classification and life cycle
Gymnosperms and angiosperms: key features and life cycles
Haplontic, diplontic, and haplo-diplontic life cycles
out_of_scope: Detailed anatomy of individual algal species

concepts.concept_name: Basis of animal classification: symmetry, coelom, segmentation, notochord
Non-chordate phyla: Porifera to Echinodermata with salient features and examples
Phylum Chordata: classes of vertebrates and their distinguishing features

in_scope: Levels of organisation, body symmetry, diploblastic vs triploblastic
Coelom types: acoelomate, pseudocoelomate, coelomate
Salient features and examples of all major phyla
Classification of Chordata up to class level with examples
out_of_scope: Detailed internal anatomy of representative species

concepts.concept_name: Root, stem, and leaf: types, modifications, and functions
Flower: parts, types of inflorescence, and floral formulae
Fruit and seed structure; description of families Fabaceae, Solanaceae, Liliaceae

in_scope: Morphology and modifications of root, stem, and leaf
Parts of a flower, aestivation, placentation
Floral diagrams and floral formulae
Semi-technical description of the three prescribed families
Types of fruits and seed structure (dicot and monocot)
out_of_scope: Detailed study of families beyond Fabaceae, Solanaceae, Liliaceae
Advanced floral ecology and pollination syndromes

concepts.concept_name: Plant tissues: meristematic and permanent (simple and complex)
Anatomy of dicot and monocot root, stem, and leaf
Secondary growth in dicot stem and root

in_scope: Classification of plant tissues: meristematic, parenchyma, collenchyma, sclerenchyma
Xylem and phloem: components and functions
Tissue systems: epidermal, ground, vascular
Comparative anatomy of dicot and monocot organs
Mechanism of secondary growth and formation of annual rings

concepts.concept_name: Animal tissues: epithelial, connective, muscular, and neural tissues
Organ and organ systems in animals; morphology and anatomy of earthworm, cockroach, and frog

in_scope: Types and functions of epithelial, connective, muscular, and neural tissues
Detailed morphology and anatomy of earthworm (Pheretima)
Detailed morphology and anatomy of cockroach (Periplaneta)
Detailed morphology and anatomy of frog (Rana)
out_of_scope: Histology of tissues at ultrastructural level
Comparative anatomy beyond the three prescribed organisms

concepts.concept_name: Cell theory; prokaryotic vs eukaryotic cell structure
Cell organelles: nucleus, mitochondria, chloroplast, ER, Golgi, lysosomes, ribosomes
Cell membrane: structure (fluid mosaic model) and transport mechanisms

in_scope: Cell theory and its contributors
Differences between prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells
Structure and function of all major cell organelles
Fluid mosaic model of cell membrane
Plant cell vs animal cell differences
out_of_scope: Detailed molecular biology of organelle biogenesis

concepts.concept_name: Carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, and nucleic acids: structure and function
Enzymes: properties, classification, and mechanism of action
Primary, secondary, tertiary, and quaternary structure of proteins

in_scope: Chemical composition and classification of carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, nucleic acids
Bond types: glycosidic, peptide, phosphodiester
Enzyme properties, cofactors, and factors affecting enzyme activity
Lock-and-key and induced fit models of enzyme action
Structure of DNA and RNA

concepts.concept_name: Cell cycle: phases (G1, S, G2, M) and regulation
Mitosis: stages, significance, and cytokinesis
Meiosis: stages, crossing over, and significance in sexual reproduction

in_scope: Phases of the cell cycle and their durations
Stages of mitosis: prophase, metaphase, anaphase, telophase
Stages of meiosis I and meiosis II
Crossing over and genetic recombination
Significance of mitosis and meiosis
out_of_scope: Molecular details of cell cycle checkpoints (CDKs and cyclins)
Cancer biology beyond basic understanding of uncontrolled division
Meiotic drive and advanced genetic phenomena

concepts.concept_name: Diffusion, osmosis, and plasmolysis; water potential and its components
Absorption of water by roots and ascent of sap
Transpiration: mechanism, factors, and significance; translocation of food

in_scope: Means of transport: diffusion, facilitated diffusion, active transport
Osmosis, water potential, solute potential, pressure potential
Apoplast and symplast pathways of water movement
Transpiration pull (cohesion-tension theory)
Pressure flow (mass flow) hypothesis for phloem transport
out_of_scope: Detailed biophysics of membrane transport proteins
Advanced mathematical treatment of water potential
Phloem loading mechanisms at molecular level

concepts.concept_name: Essential mineral elements: macro and micronutrients, criteria of essentiality
Deficiency symptoms and toxicity of mineral elements
Nitrogen metabolism: nitrogen cycle, biological nitrogen fixation

in_scope: Classification of essential elements and their roles
Deficiency symptoms: chlorosis, necrosis, stunted growth
Mechanism of absorption of mineral ions
Nitrogen cycle and biological nitrogen fixation
Role of Rhizobium and nitrogenase enzyme
out_of_scope: Detailed soil chemistry and soil science
Hydroponics and aeroponics technology in detail

concepts.concept_name: Light reactions: photosystems, electron transport chain, photophosphorylation
Calvin cycle (C3 pathway) and carbon fixation
C4 pathway, photorespiration, and factors affecting photosynthesis

in_scope: Structure of chloroplast and photosynthetic pigments
Photosystem I and II, Z-scheme of electron transport
Cyclic and non-cyclic photophosphorylation
Calvin cycle: carboxylation, reduction, regeneration
C4 pathway (Hatch-Slack), Kranz anatomy, photorespiration
Factors affecting photosynthesis: light, CO2, temperature, water

concepts.concept_name: Glycolysis, TCA cycle (Krebs cycle), and oxidative phosphorylation
Fermentation: anaerobic respiration and its types
Respiratory quotient and amphibolic nature of respiration

in_scope: Glycolysis: steps, net gain of ATP and NADH
TCA cycle: substrate, products, and energy yield
Electron transport system and chemiosmotic hypothesis
Alcoholic and lactic acid fermentation
Respiratory quotient for different substrates
Amphibolic pathways
out_of_scope: Detailed enzyme mechanisms of each glycolytic step

concepts.concept_name: Phases of growth, growth rate, and conditions for growth
Plant growth regulators: auxins, gibberellins, cytokinins, ethylene, ABA
Photoperiodism, vernalisation, and seed dormancy

in_scope: Phases of growth: meristematic, elongation, maturation
Growth rates: arithmetic and geometric; growth curves
Discovery, physiological roles, and agricultural applications of each PGR
Photoperiodism: short-day, long-day, and day-neutral plants
Vernalisation and seed dormancy mechanisms
out_of_scope: Molecular signalling pathways of plant hormones
Tissue culture and micropropagation techniques in detail

concepts.concept_name: Human alimentary canal: structure and functions of each region
Digestive glands and enzymes: salivary, gastric, pancreatic, intestinal secretions
Absorption of digested products and disorders of the digestive system

in_scope: Structure of alimentary canal from mouth to anus
Role of salivary amylase, pepsin, trypsin, lipase, and other enzymes
Digestion in the stomach, small intestine, and large intestine
Absorption mechanisms in the small intestine
Common disorders: PEM, indigestion, constipation, vomiting, jaundice, diarrhoea
out_of_scope: Detailed hormonal regulation of digestion (GIP, secretin pathways)
Surgical procedures of the GI tract

concepts.concept_name: Human respiratory system: structure and mechanism of breathing
Exchange and transport of gases: oxygen and carbon dioxide
Regulation of respiration and respiratory disorders

in_scope: Organs of the respiratory system and their structure
Mechanism of breathing: inspiration and expiration
Lung volumes and capacities (tidal volume, vital capacity, etc.)
Oxygen-haemoglobin dissociation curve
Transport of O2 and CO2 in blood
Disorders: asthma, emphysema, occupational lung diseases
out_of_scope: Detailed neural circuitry of the respiratory centre
Altitude physiology and deep-sea diving physiology

concepts.concept_name: Composition of blood: plasma, RBC, WBC, platelets; blood groups and coagulation
Human heart: structure, cardiac cycle, and cardiac output
Double circulation, regulation of cardiac activity, and circulatory disorders

in_scope: Composition of blood and lymph
ABO and Rh blood grouping; blood coagulation cascade overview
Structure of human heart: chambers, valves, blood vessels
Cardiac cycle: systole, diastole, heart sounds
ECG: basic interpretation of P, QRS, T waves
Double circulation: pulmonary and systemic
Disorders: hypertension, coronary artery disease, angina, heart failure

concepts.concept_name: Human excretory system: structure of kidney and nephron
Urine formation: glomerular filtration, tubular reabsorption, and secretion
Regulation of kidney function and disorders of the excretory system

in_scope: Structure of kidney, nephron (cortical and juxtamedullary)
Mechanism of urine formation: ultrafiltration, reabsorption, secretion
Counter-current mechanism in loop of Henle and vasa recta
Role of ADH and aldosterone in osmoregulation
Disorders: uraemia, renal failure, renal calculi, nephritis
Dialysis and kidney transplant (basic understanding)

concepts.concept_name: Types of movement; human skeletal system: axial and appendicular skeleton
Joints: types and movements; structure of skeletal muscle and contractile proteins
Mechanism of muscle contraction (sliding filament theory) and muscular disorders

in_scope: Types of movement: amoeboid, ciliary, muscular
Human skeleton: bones of axial and appendicular skeleton
Types of joints: fibrous, cartilaginous, synovial
Structure of skeletal muscle: sarcomere, actin, myosin
Sliding filament theory of muscle contraction
Disorders: myasthenia gravis, muscular dystrophy, tetany, arthritis, osteoporosis, gout
out_of_scope: Molecular biology of muscle growth and repair

concepts.concept_name: Neuron structure, nerve impulse generation, and synaptic transmission
Central nervous system: brain structure and spinal cord; reflex action
Sensory organs: structure and function of eye and ear

in_scope: Structure of neuron: dendrite, axon, cell body, myelin sheath
Generation and conduction of nerve impulse; resting and action potential
Synaptic transmission: neurotransmitters
Structure of human brain: cerebrum, cerebellum, medulla, hypothalamus
Reflex arc and reflex action
Structure and function of the eye; common defects and corrections
Structure and function of the ear; mechanism of hearing and balance
out_of_scope: Psychiatric and neurological disorders in clinical detail

concepts.concept_name: Endocrine glands: hypothalamus, pituitary, thyroid, parathyroid, adrenal, pancreas, gonads
Hormones: chemical nature, mechanism of action, and physiological effects
Hormonal disorders: hypo and hypersecretion conditions

in_scope: Location and hormones of all major endocrine glands
Mechanism of hormone action: through membrane receptors and intracellular receptors
Feedback regulation of hormonal secretion
Disorders: dwarfism, acromegaly, goitre, diabetes mellitus, Addison's disease, Cushing's syndrome
Role of hormones in growth, metabolism, and homeostasis
out_of_scope: Detailed signal transduction pathways (second messenger cascades)
